immediate_actions: Call emergency services immediately (911/108/999)
Have the person sit down and rest
Loosen any tight clothing
If person has prescribed nitroglycerin, help them take it
If person becomes unconscious and stops breathing, begin CPR
Do NOT give food or water
warning_signs: Pain in arms, back, neck, jaw, or stomach
do_not: Leave the person alone except to call for help
Allow the person to deny symptoms
Wait to see if symptoms go away
Give anything by mouth unless heart medication

immediate_actions: Call emergency services immediately - time is critical
Note the time symptoms started
Use FAST test: Face drooping, Arm weakness, Speech difficulty, Time to call 911
Keep person calm and lying down with head slightly elevated
Do NOT give food, drink, or medication

fast_test.F: Face - Ask person to smile. Does one side droop?
fast_test.A: Arms - Ask person to raise both arms. Does one drift down?
fast_test.S: Speech - Ask person to repeat a simple phrase. Is speech slurred?
fast_test.T: Time - If any symptoms present, call emergency immediately

immediate_actions: Call emergency services if bleeding is severe
Protect yourself - wear gloves if available
Apply direct pressure with clean cloth
Maintain pressure for at least 10 minutes
If blood soaks through, add more cloth on top
Elevate the injured area above heart if possible
Apply pressure to arterial pressure points if needed
do_not: Peek at wound while applying pressure
Use a tourniquet unless trained and as last resort

immediate_actions: Ask 'Are you choking?' If they can't speak, act immediately
Perform Heimlich maneuver (abdominal thrusts)
Stand behind person, wrap arms around waist
Make fist above navel, grasp with other hand
Give quick upward thrusts
Repeat until object is expelled or person becomes unconscious
If unconscious, begin CPR and call emergency services
for_infants: Give 5 back blows between shoulder blades

immediate_actions: Find a quiet, safe space
Practice 4-7-8 breathing: Inhale 4 counts, hold 7, exhale 8
Use 5-4-3-2-1 grounding technique
Remind yourself: 'This will pass, I am safe'
Contact crisis helpline if needed: 988 (USA) / 9152987821 (India)
Take all thoughts seriously - this is a medical emergency
Call National Suicide Prevention Lifeline: 988 (USA) / 9152987821 (India)
Text 'HELLO' to 741741 (Crisis Text Line)
Do NOT leave person alone
Remove access to means of self-harm
Listen without judgment
Get professional help immediately
what_not_to_say: 'You have so much to live for'

immediate_actions: Ground yourself in the present
Use sensory grounding: touch something cold, smell something strong
Remind yourself: 'I am safe now, this is a memory'
Practice deep breathing
Contact therapist or crisis line if needed
grounding_techniques: Hold ice cubes or splash cold water
Stomp your feet to feel the ground
Name today's date, your age, where you are

during_earthquake: COVER head and neck under sturdy table/desk
Stay away from windows, mirrors, heavy objects
If in bed, stay there and cover head with pillow
If outdoors, move away from buildings, trees, power lines
If in vehicle, pull over and stay inside
do_not: Light matches if you smell gas

immediate_actions: Move to higher ground immediately
Never walk through moving water (6 inches can knock you down)
Never drive through flooded roads (Turn Around, Don't Drown)
Evacuate if told to do so
Disconnect electrical appliances if safe to do so
Do NOT touch electrical equipment if wet
Alert everyone - shout 'FIRE!'
Activate fire alarm if available
Call emergency services: 911 (USA) / 101 (India)
Evacuate immediately - do NOT gather belongings
Feel doors before opening (if hot, use alternate route)
Crawl low under smoke
Close doors behind you to slow fire spread
Meet at designated assembly point
if_trapped: Close door between you and fire
Seal cracks with cloth to keep smoke out
Call emergency services with your location
do_not: Break windows (may feed fire with oxygen)

during_hurricane: Go to interior room on lowest floor
Do NOT go outside during 'eye' of storm
